course.subject: ENGG
course.name: Academic Orientation
course.description: This course is designed specifically for engineering students of the First Year of 4Y curriculum. This year-long course aims at providing an induction to the School of Engineering for the freshmen year. It will cover topics such as learning and time-management skills, purposes of university and engineering education, and planning for personal and professional development. Graded PP, P or F. For Year 1 Engineering students only.

reviews.author: 蒒丁格的內褲
reviews.comment_content:
同HLTH1010一齊被稱為UST 2大KILLER
大部分YRS1既新仔都係因為呢兩個無用既COURSE GG左
留意下個REQUIREMENT 做齊野就無事
包括聽2個TALK 搵PEER MENTOR 同JOIN佢D活動
reviews.comment_teaching:
冇咩好教 聽佢個TALK佢會教你ENGG有咩用
讀ENG有咩出路咁
但係每個人去到個TALK都係去訓教OR玩手機
因為講個D都係COMMON野
reviews.comment_grading:
只有P同F
拎F YRS2會揀唔到MAJOR 逼住讀多年 到時喊都無謂
reviews.comment_workload:
要去PDS同聽下TALK咁
算叫做0WORKLOAD

reviews.author: I Want 1st Hon!
reviews.title: Welcome to ENGG1010!
reviews.comment_content:
In Late August (before year 1):
You will be assigned to a clan that you choose in HKUST. There will be a Orientation Day for HKUST members. I recommend you attend this since it provides opportunities to meet ENGG friends!

The clan is mainly for peer-advising. Be sure to find a suitable clan which peer mentors are studying some majors you are interested in!
Besides, you are recommended to find a peer mentor who is RESPONSIBLE & EFFECTIVELY answering your questions.

After Entrance of Year 1:
Compulsory for Year 1 Engineering Students.
Minimum Compulsory Requirement:
Fall:
1 Compulsory lecture;
1 Compulsory Professional Development Seminar (PDS);
1 Peer mentoring (From you own clan);
1 School Faculty Advisor (SFA) Meeting;
2 Safety Trainings (Attend all, Bring iPRS!)

Spring:
1 Compulsory lecture;
1 Compulsory Professional Development Seminar (PDS);
1 Peer mentoring (From you own clan);
2 Safety Trainings (Attend all, Bring iPRS!)
You don't need to meet the SFA in Spring unless your GPA<2 or you transfer from another school!

If your clan's time slot is not available, you can choose other slot by finding E^2i in the Engineering Common Office.
reviews.comment_teaching:
There are a lot different instructors, but the main instructor is PONG, TING CHUEN (from CS department)!

You cannot listen what the speakers saying because a lot of people didn't respect him by talking aloud to their friends. However, the speakers already tries their best to talk.
Hence, the presenters go through the slides very fast.

You can sometime find some pdf in canvas about important talks after the talks.
reviews.comment_grading:
Only pass or fail.
Too easy to pass, though it is meaningful.
If you do not pass, you can't choose your own major.

Best 24 Credits as the major Criteria for all majors. CIVL&MECH&DSCT has ranking requirement.

CIVL requires the most:
1)LANG1002&1003;
2)MATH(1012/1013&1014)/(*1020)/(1023&1024)
3)PHYS1112/1312 OR CHEM1010/1020
These courses will be counted into your BEST 24 Credits *MATH1020=6 Credits

MECH requires:
1) Any PHYS/CHEM/LIFS Course
2)MATH(1012/1013&1014)/(*1020)/(1023&1024)
These courses will be counted into your BEST 24 Credits *MATH1020=6 Credits

DSCT requires COMP1021/1022P/1022Q completion in year 1 for choosing major.

Other majors only count for your best 24 credits with no special ranking requirement.
CBE/SEE Counts MATH1020 for 6 Credits.

For Quota problem, it can sometimes be more/unchanged:
ECE: 135  CIVL:160  MAE: 145
CPEG: 95  CSE: 130  DSCT: 20
CBE: 90  IEDA: 90  SEE: 30

All major result announcement (announced through outlook mail) and next semester (Fall) pre-enrollment (E-advising) will be held in late June!
reviews.comment_workload:
Please arrive punctually (they closed all registrations after 15 minutes.)
Just fulfill the minimum requirement, it has already been fine!
OR if you want to engage more, you can participate in the PDSs!

Remember to ask your peer mentors if you have any question!

reviews.author: A.
reviews.comment_content:
Fall:
1 Compulsory lecture;
1 Compulsory Professional Development Seminar (PDS);
1 Peer mentoring (From you own clan);
1 School Faculty Advisor (SFA) Meeting;
2 Safety Trainings (Attend all, Bring iPRS!)

Spring:
1 Compulsory lecture;
1 Compulsory Professional Development Seminar (PDS);
1 Peer mentoring (From you own clan);
2 Safety Trainings
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite a few different professors. Might help some people decide on their engineering majors. Some introductory talks and lectures etc. Introduction with peer mentors.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or fail. Ensure you attend all the compulsory classes to fulfill the requirements and get into your chosen major. Failure to attend compulsory classes may result in a fail for the whole course.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. Just attend the compulsory classes.

reviews.author: cwl.Alex
reviews.title: Nothing to say
reviews.comment_content: It tells you the essential things in ENGG, e.g. major selection, ENGG1010 requirements, the possible career, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The rule of the teachers in the talks are lenient, my friend can even play GTA while in the talk. You can also work on homework in the talk, as long as you do not affect others.

They are just reading along with the slides, no out-see stuff, so do not worry about the lectures. Even if you miss some stuff, you can check e-mails and slides on Canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass if finished all required items, and fail if otherwise.
Easy and simple.

This year, the course even have make-up sessions and worksheets to do if you missed the important talks. You can also write a few paragraphs to compensate if you missed the compulsory lecture. (though not recommended to do so)
reviews.comment_workload:
Compulsory talk (only a few throughout the semester)
Need to meet peer mentor at least two times and advisor at least once
Elective PDS (min 3 hrs): talks, workshops, lab sessions, etc.

Almost zero workloads to a first-year student, you can use the talk as your homework/ revision time anyway.

reviews.author: Luweegee
reviews.title: IF YOU FAIL THIS YOU CAN'T CHOOSE MAJOR
reviews.comment_content:
Just complete the following tasks PER SEMESTER and you'll be good:
1. Welcoming Talk @ LTJ (Check your timetable for the time)
2. Peer Advising - Hand in your study plan to your peer adviser from your engineering clans
3. At least 1 PDS (Professional Development Seminar) - Usually talks or workshops
4. Meeting with Faculty Mentor

Please get these done (especially PDS) as soon as possible! If you fail this, you may not be able to choose your engineering major!
reviews.comment_teaching:
No teaching. Just attend the boring talks :)

The talks usually introduces to you different engineering majors so it can be helpful
reviews.comment_grading: Graded on Pass or Fail. You can check your progress under grades column in your Canvas
reviews.comment_workload: Zero workload. Just show up in the talks and record attendance. Simple enough, but please remember to meet the requirements

reviews.author: rayjim
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction of all the works of engineers
Please attend the several of Elective PDS (min 3 hrs). Talks and workshops are preferred to attend. Remember that you should contact your academic advisor and peer mentor, including zoom and face-to-face. If you miss any things above, you will get [partly pass] at the end. Major selection can't be executed in year 2.
reviews.comment_teaching: These lectures are taught by some professors and students. It is an quite interesting course.
reviews.comment_grading: no grading, only pass or not.
reviews.comment_workload: Low workload, there are some online surveys, which must be finished.

reviews.author: mark_
reviews.title: nothing much
reviews.comment_content:
Nothing much. Attend the compulsory lectures that they tell you to or write a reflection after watching the recording if you missed it.

In addition you have to meet your peer mentor once per semester and your academic advisor for a "chat" in the first semester.

You also have to attend 3 "professional development hours" each semester. These can be special lectures they give or field trips to interesting places where engineering has been applied.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nothing special, the talks they give are interesting sometimes and the field trips are mostly boring.

You mainly want to attend the first talk to experience Ben Chan ;)
reviews.comment_grading: Pass/fail. You have to satisfy all the requirements mentioned above otherwise you fail and you will not be able to select your major at the end of year 1. Requirements are per-semester and if you don't meet them in either fall/spring semeseter, you fail the course.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light. The only thing you need to put effort into are the PDS - you should be proactive and get them out of the way as soon as possible so you can focus on other things.

reviews.author: gonpachirou
reviews.title: Very easy to pass but detrimental if you fail
reviews.comment_content:
Content is delivered through powerpoint presentations via Zoom this semester. Most of it is quite basic, e.g. the Common Core curriculum and credits required for graduation, and the professor mainly reads off the slides. You should be fine by just taking screenshots of all the slides (or not, since all the information is available online)

You are divided into 9 clans at the start of the semester and within your clan are peer mentors, 2+ year students who serve as advisors for your studies in SENG.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not much to say about teaching since all content is pretty basic. Teaching is satisfactory since at the end of the lecture most students seem to understand the requirements of being in SENG.
reviews.comment_grading:
A pass/fail course.

You will fail if you do not attend both compulsory lectures or if you attend less than 3 hrs of the Personal Development Sessions. You will also fail if you fail to meet up with your peer mentor (part of your clan) or fail to meet up with your SENG advisor.

Major selection will occur next June and some majors require pre-requisite courses to be able to enroll. A minimum of 24 credits (accumulated from Fall + Spring) are required to enroll in a major.

Quota for majors are as follows:
ECE: 135  CIVL:160  MAE: 145
CPEG: 95  CSE: 130  DSCT: 20
CBE: 90  IEDA: 90  SEE: 30
reviews.comment_workload:
Not that difficult to pass but again, if you fail this course you will not be able to select a major in the coming year.

Just make sure to attend all compulsory lectures within 15 minutes of the start time and attend at least 3 hrs of the Personal Development Sessions. These were held in Zoom this year, so it's quite easy to gain attendance by just opening up Zoom and doing homework / other work. Notifications are also given through e-mail so they are hard to miss.

reviews.author: Vincentchan9839
reviews.title: A compulsory 0 credits course for all Year 1 Engineering Students
reviews.comment_content:
There are only 4 tasks you need to fulfill:

1) Attend a compulsory lecture (usually at the very beginning of each semester)

2) Meet with your peer mentor (include Making your study plan & Intake survey) (from the middle of September to the end of September)

3) Meet with your faculty advisor (20 minutes, at the end of October to the beginning of November)

4) Attend at least 3 contact hours of approved Professional Development Seminar/activity (PDS) (throughout the whole semester, see the attached picture for more details)

For more detailed information, please take a look at the attached files below.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Actually there is nearly no teaching. I would say the only thing that involve teaching (but not that really) is the compulsory lecture during the start of the semester and the seminars.

The lecture is just some boring things. Just listen to what the professors have said and you are done.  (By the way, Professor Ben Chan (CHAN, Yui Bun) is so handsome :) )

The seminars (usually held in LT-J) are just similar to the compulsory lecture - boring. Actually, many engineering students do their own things after entering LT-J and are not listening to the speakers. So, you can ignore the speakers and do your own things as long as you do not disturb someone else. Nobody will stop you from that.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail only.

It is very easy to pass ENGG1010: just fulfill all the requirements as stated in the attached .pdf file. (Usually 3 to 4 tasks for each semester)

Otherwise, you are not allowed to select your major at the end of the coming spring semester.

Grade: P (Updated on 11 June, 2022)
reviews.comment_workload:
One of the least workload course for Year 1 engineering student. The only thing involved is attendance.

You just need to attend 3 hours seminars/workshops (PDS) (usually 1.5 hours each) for each semester, meet your peer mentor, meet your advisor, attend a compulsory lecture at the start of the semester, you will get a pass.

If you are the person that want to complete all things as soon as possible, you will automatically know (without School of Engineering notifying you beforehand) that you have passed ENGG1010 about a month before the end of the semester.

Here is a tip for all of you: go to LT-J at least 20 minutes earlier before the start of the seminar. Otherwise, you will see there is a long queue outside LT-J if you come there a little bit late. For the worst case, you may not allowed to enter LT-J as the lecture theatre is full.

reviews.author: purpleworld
reviews.comment_content:
For this semester
Compulsory zoom meeting
1 peer mentoring section
1 faculty advisor section
3 hours of pds
More detailed description are in other reviews already and may be different (?) each year (I'm not sure
reviews.comment_teaching:
The compulsory zoom meeting includes some useful information and inspiring talk. The teaching is ok. (People are having fun in chat box as well which may be a source of entertainment too.

For faculty advisor, he will answer any questions including academic and non-academic.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail
Just do everything as told then it will be fine
(Attend compulsory zoom or you will need to write 200 words which I do not need to)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine, for example the peer mentoring section is only 15 minutes. Seminars are only 3 hours per semester

reviews.author: 準雷
reviews.title: 好hea, 但要Pass先可以揀Major
reviews.comment_content:
Year1 SENG必修, 係一年既course:

reviews.comment_teaching: 可以多D問peer mentor你唔明既野
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass/Fail
我緊係Pass啦
reviews.comment_workload:
好hea
做足哂要求就得

reviews.author: Watermelon
reviews.comment_content:
大概係俾大家喺第一年入到嚟，了解大學生活，同埋要點樣選擇自己嘅Major。
/
**pass咗先可以選擇major**
reviews.comment_teaching: 呢個course基本上唔會學到啲咩，只係一個基本requirement，不過都會了解工程系入面每一科嘅內容。
reviews.comment_grading:
一定reach佢嘅requirement先會pass。
/
每個sem有1堂compulsory classes，同埋至少聽2場talk。
2個sem都要見一次peer mentors，同埋Fall sem之後要見faculty advisor一次。
reviews.comment_workload:
workload就係只要聽talk，見peer mentors同faculty advisor就得。
/
如果miss咗compulsory class，要睇recording，加一份reflection (>200字)。不過盡量唔好miss。

reviews.author: HKUST-1
reviews.comment_content:
SENG Year 1 Auto Reg Course, Cannot drop, must do all the requirement or you will not be able to declare major.

In fall semester, you need to do peer advising, meeting with advisor, and take some talks.

In Spring Semester, you still need to do peer advising, if you met your advisor, you don't need to go again. You need to listen to major selection talk, 3 major introduction talk, or you will fail this course if you fail to do so.
reviews.comment_teaching: No teaching
reviews.comment_grading: Peer Advising, Meeting with Advisor, seminar, are required in this ENGG 1010.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy since you are a toxic engineering student and it requires you to talk with peer mentor and advisor.

Not heavy if you are extrovert.

reviews.author: wwy
reviews.title: Don't fail this course
reviews.comment_content:
Just finish everything in the course then you will be fine.
1. Compulsory Lecture: This is where they tell you about this list
2. PDSs: At least 3 hours Professional Development Seminar per semester
3. Peer Advising: Talk with your peer mentor and fill a non-binding form about what you're planning to do this year
4. Faculty Advising: Talk with your faculty

Don't forget these things!
reviews.comment_teaching: Depends on which talks or workshop you attend. Hard to say which one is better or not, just find some workshop or talk u like.
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F
nothing special
Just finish everything required and then you will be safe.
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair, neither too heavy nor too light.
If you pass HLTH 1010, then this course is not a problem for you.

reviews.author: rch
reviews.title: Just remember to fulfill the requirements
reviews.comment_content:
Introductory talks and workshops about different facets of engineering.

Clear guidelines to follow, and you can choose what to attend according to your interests and preferences. If you chose to study engineering out of interest, the content will be rewarding and enlightening for you; if not, you can just play on your phone/do your own work like everyone else -- no one cares as long as the digital records show that you were physically there.
reviews.comment_teaching: Depends on the talk/workshop for comments on individual content or delivery, but the compulsory lecture was clear, and the powerpoint (with all the important information/guidelines) was uploaded on Canvas afterwards, so definitely nothing to complain about.
reviews.comment_grading:
Only Pass/Fail. Just remember to attend all the compulsory things and fulfill all the requirements, or you won't get to choose your major.

However, due to current circumstances, a lot of students were unable to meet with their advisors or complete their other requirements as some activities were scheduled on suspended days.

So, for the Fall semester, everyone received the grade 'PP' = Permission to Proceed, regardless of whether they have fulfilled all their requirements yet. Should be normal for other semesters though.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 compulsory lecture, 1 meeting with your peer mentor, 1 meeting with your faculty advisor and at least 3 hours of approved PDS (Professional Development Seminar/activity).

Nothing much, but all necessary. Depends if you think any workload for a 0-credit course is too much workload, I guess.

Everything's clearly laid out for you during the first compulsory lecture though, and supposedly your peer mentor will remind you of anything you need to do, so nothing to stress too much over.

For the PDS hours, you can either attend introductory engineering talks (1.5hr each usually) or attend one workshop of 3 hours (3D printing, laser cutting, etc.). Just remember to sign up in advance if you want to attend the workshops since there is a limited quota.

Honestly, the only complaint I have about the workload is that the time block for this course takes up every week for the whole semester despite the minimal workload. So even though you actually only show up once or twice during the allotted time (advising and workshops are held at other times, and talks may be held on a day that wasn't allotted to you), it stops you from registering for other courses that are set at the same time, especially tutorials.

reviews.comment_content: There are various talks available with different topics, ranging from some information about the major, to some exchange or internship information.
reviews.comment_teaching: I dunno coz i didnt listen. Most of the people just sit there and doing their own stuff without listening to the professors.
reviews.comment_grading: You have to attend some talks or workshop to fulfil the 3 PDS hours requirement but it's really easy. Just attend 2 talks whenever you like and talks to your peer mentor and professor once, and that's it. However, if you failed this course, you cannot choose your major in spring. Like HLTH1010. Pass or fail only.
reviews.comment_workload: Just attend 2 talks and have mentoring. Easy.

reviews.author: 神月 godmoon
reviews.comment_content: Wide range of talks and workshops organized by professional engineers. You can certainly learn a lot of knowledge
reviews.comment_teaching:
ummmmm not quite easy to say
Different activities are organized by respective professors
For example in this year, we have lazer cutting, 3D printing workshop, HKTVMALL field trip, programming course(one of my favourite <3)
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F
nothing special
don't forget about health course as well
Otherwise you cannot choose the major in the next year
reviews.comment_workload:
.....................
not quite good
but fair
It requires 3 hours participation
Comparing with Health, you ahould be OK!^V^

reviews.author: Wil
reviews.title: 0 teaching 0 workload
reviews.comment_content:
Students who participate in this course are expected to:
1. Understand the purpose of university education
2. Strengthen student’s self-understanding in terms of character and learning habit
3. Acquire time management and study planning skills
4. Cultivate the ability to think critically and ethically
5. Develop as a self-regulated learner
6. Engage in personal and professional development

simply ：
---- 1 compulsory lecture
---- 1 PDS (Professional development seminar)
---- Meeting with peer mentor in ur clan, short talk
---- Meeting with ur assigned faculty advisor, just one of the professors and a short casual talk for 20 min
reviews.comment_teaching:
no teaching at all
boring and useless
insignificant
reviews.comment_grading:
Only pass or fail
so difficult to fail......
this is a two sem course, so u will get a PP for fall term
P for the whole year grade
reviews.comment_workload:
just go for the four things
pretty easy
basically no workload at all

reviews.author: cdemirer
reviews.comment_content:
If you are a SENG Year 1 student, then you better pass this course or you get no major the 2nd year.
In 2018-19, there are 4 main things you have to attend:
1. Compulsory Lecture: This is where they tell you about this list
2. PDSs: At least 1 Professional Development Seminar per semester
3. Peer Advising: Talk with your peer mentor and fill a non-binding form about what you're planning to do this year
4. Faculty Advising: Talk with your faculty advisor
The easiest thing to do in order to not miss these events is to check your emails.
reviews.comment_teaching: All parts are useful to some extent. There are many PDSs and you can find at least 1-2 which you're interested in. Check your emails.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is on a P/F basis, depending on whether you fulfilled the requirements above. Check your emails.
reviews.comment_workload: Only attendance which is described above. Most important thing is to not miss the number 1. I think it's quite easy to do number 2. And number 3 and 4 require scheduling beforehand but not a challenge. Check your emails.

reviews.author: Terence Pang
reviews.comment_content:
1. PDS Talk
2. Find peer mentor
3. Find faculty advisor (prof)

For each sem
reviews.comment_teaching: All people play phones / sleep in the lecture theater. So basically no teaching involved.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail
Check your email = impossible to fail

Just do what you are required to do according to email. Book your time to meet faculty advisor and mentor.
reviews.comment_workload:
No marking involved.
Better think about what you would like to say before meeting faculty advisor to avoid dead air(?). But the atmosphere when meeting my advisor is relaxed. Just a few min (<10 min) of casual chatting and you can go.

reviews.author: wscho
reviews.comment_content: Every students in SENG (Year 1) need to attend this course. (Or pre-enrolled).
reviews.comment_teaching: There are no teaching, but the students are expected to check the requirements (at workload section).
reviews.comment_grading: Although this is a 0-credit course, the school expects you to check your requirements (written in workload section). If not completed, you will fail the course and also will be unable to  choose your major.
reviews.comment_workload:
Requirements:
1 compulsory lecture in fall semester
- A compulsory seminar is held at the start of the semester, introducing the kinds of SENG and the issues related to engineering, etc.
1 compulsory lecture in spring semester
2 meetings with peer mentor
- Students are required to meet their academic advisors at E2I office for academic assistance - plan the courses and preparing to select the majors
Complete required surveys and questionnaires.

reviews.author: SQ Flyer
reviews.title: Just complete all the required sections and done
reviews.comment_content:
ENGG 1010 is a compulsory and non-credit bearing course for all Engineering students in their first year of study.
The course consists of several components. A compulsory seminar is held at the start of the semester, introducing the engineering school and the issues related to engineering, so as to inspire students possibility to engage in different aspects of engineering. Other than the compulsory seminar, students are required to meet the academic advisors at E2I for academic assistance and academic planning, so as to help students get equipped to select their major at the end of Year 1. Meet the peer mentor and join the activities to meet some engineering friends and grab different useful resources from them. Also, remember to complete the required surveys and questionnaires.

attend the professional development activities.

Safety training is mandatory but maybe useful for students who wish to obtain practical skills for specific major. you don't need to attend all the safety training sessions in Year 1 but still remember to complete all the requirements before graduation.
reviews.comment_teaching: The compulsory seminar is some how boring, since it starts at 6, most students are tired and wish to go back home for dinner. Not a lot students pay attention and simply work on their own stuffs.
reviews.comment_grading:
Just pass or fail.
ATTENDANCE IS REALLY IMPORTANT OR ELSE YOU CAN'T SELECT YOUR MAJOR

SO CHECK YOUR OUTLOOK ACCOUNT REGULARLY FOR LATEST UPDATES.

NO ONE CAN HELP YOU IF YOU MISS THE SECTIONS REQUIRED.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost No workload
Just complete the required lectures and activities.

if those activities are held during mid term period, it maybe a disaster for many students.

For safety training sessions, you are required to complete a quiz for each session with a passing score of 80%.

reviews.author: gearlessjoe
reviews.title: just attend the necessary stuff to pass so you can select your major next year
reviews.comment_content:
Four things:
Every semester, you need to:
1. Attend the compulsory lecture
2. Meet with peer mentor — probably the most useful thing in this course, ask them any questions about school. My mentor taught me how to use the printer haha.
3. Meet with faculty advisor
4. Attend at least one professional development seminar (PDS) — a lot of stuff to pick from (talks/workshop where you make stuff etc.), and you only need to go to one, so just pick what interests you most from the list
There's also some safety training that's not mandatory but might be a prerequisite/requirement for certain courses + graduation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Only teaching is the talks given. For the compulsory lecture I'm pretty sure no one paid attention the lecturer was just going on about how you can turn E2I into some acronym that stands for all the engineering departments at HKUST.
reviews.comment_grading: Show up and you'll pass. Doesn't get easier than that.
reviews.comment_workload: None, just show up. Kind of sucks everything is at night so I spent the entire day at school just waiting for the lectures and PDS.

reviews.author: Juicers
reviews.comment_content:
聽TALK
搵PEER MENTOR
搵professor咁囉
唔做齊就會攞F開心仔
reviews.comment_teaching:
其實無野教
個talk會講你D出路?
不過好common應該係人都知

reviews.author: katexlh
reviews.comment_content:
Compulsory:
1. Welcome lecture *1 (? (~90 min)
2. Peer advisor meeting *1 (20-30 min)
3. Academic advisor meeting *1 (20-30 min)
4. PDS (choose one boring lecture) *1 (~90min)
Everything will be notified by emails.
reviews.comment_teaching: They did try to teach us something, but because the boring contents and compulsory basis, what contained in the course became relatively not important at all, as well as the teaching :3
reviews.comment_grading: Either pass or fail is given. It is quite easy to get a "P" as long as you fulfill some easy requirements (as what is mentioned in the column "content.")
reviews.comment_workload: DON'T WORRY!!! IT TAKES UP MUCH TIME IN YOUR TIMETABLE, BUT MOST OF THE LECTURE TIMESLOTS ARE SPARED. Quite easy since you can attend a PDS and do your own thing all the time. Or you may skip any right after taking attendance if you want.

reviews.author: ho_hin
reviews.comment_content:
Every engineering freshman need to attend this course. Remember to go to safety training although they said it is not compulsory for year 1.
Actually it is the graduation requirement of every engineering student. If you do not go to the training, you can't go to lab for your experiment.
reviews.comment_teaching: There are no teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: It is a 0-credit course but you need to finish all requirement. Otherwise, you will be failed and you cannot choose the major.
reviews.comment_workload: 1 talk in fall sem and 1 talk in spring sem, 2 meeting with peer mentor

reviews.author: no$left
reviews.comment_content:
This course is designed specifically for engineering students of the First Year of 4Y curriculum. This year-long course aims at providing an induction to the School of Engineering for the freshmen year. It will cover topics such as learning and time-management skills, purposes of university and engineering education, and planning for personal and professional development. Graded PP, P or F. For Year 1 Engineering students only.

When fall sem starts, there is a compulsory lecture.
You need to talk to ur own academic adviser.
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring and useless
reviews.comment_grading:
If you do all stuff, you got a pass.
It is impossible to get a fail in this course unless you skip all lectures.
reviews.comment_workload:
Few and nearly no workload
Attend few lecture
talk to adviser for 10 mins.
Done

reviews.author: lydiamlkkkkkkkk
reviews.comment_content: some lectures about the field of enginnering. I found it quite boring actually and I don't find them useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: N/A
reviews.comment_grading: there is F, P and PP. it is hard to fail.  All you need to do is follow the instructions and you are done. Be careful about the deadline and check emails frequently to make sure you don't miss any lecture.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. just attend two compulsory lectures, complete PRS quiz and seeing advisor. There are instructions given in the first lecture so no worry.

reviews.author: pdf
reviews.title: You will gg when you got an F
reviews.comment_content: Not much of a content coz you are basically forced to attend the lectures...However, some major related lectures are highly recommended coz it's the best chance to know your future major...even got some registrations for HKIE student chapter.
reviews.comment_teaching: Em....most of the professor or lecturer do not know how to present their lecture material in a more interesting way..but they don't really care whether you are listening anyways haha..most of the students are either sleeping or playing games with their macbook lol...so...if it's not an interest topic...basically boring and sleepy...
reviews.comment_grading: Fair...if you can fulfilled the min requirement..and it's easy to fulfill lol
reviews.comment_workload: No workload...merely extra resting time...

reviews.author: rubbish999
reviews.comment_content: 每個sem都有2次compulsory既seminar同埋safety training, 去到撳prs, 再聽多兩個professional development seminar (pds)就搞掂
reviews.comment_teaching: 其實冇咩teaching可言, 去到坐低個個打機/訓覺, 夠鐘撳prs就起身跟住走人, 根本冇人會聽d prof講野
reviews.comment_grading:
得P同F, 其實都冇乜可能F, 除非去都唔去啦
F左就會冇major
reviews.comment_workload: 純粹去坐同埋訓覺/打機同埋最後撳prs, 乜都唔洗做

reviews.author: stereo
reviews.title: F左揀唔到major－－正常人都唔會F
reviews.comment_content:
Fall同Spring都有PDS x2, safety training x2
Fall一開sem仲有個compulsory leecture, 同埋要見academic advisor
Spring如果你有academic issue先要去見

如果走左任何一個compulsory seminar (Spring sem 第一日就有)/ 聽唔齊兩個PDS , 除非你夠誠懇求到make-up... 否則你ENGG F左就揀唔到major
reviews.comment_teaching: N/A
reviews.comment_grading: 得F, PP同P ... 冇乜特別
reviews.comment_workload: 輕鬆, 除非你到sem尾都未聽過任何一個PDS－－最後幾個Seminar LTJ出面係打哂蛇餅(walk-in)都未必排到, 到呢個情況有得reg seminar就reg左先 (差d就F左ENGG OTL)

reviews.author: Maurice
reviews.comment_content: Compulsory course for all engineering students in their first year of study. Basically you just need keep attending seminars in different areas. Some seminars will be related to your major selection.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very boring if are not interest in the content in that seminar. Most of the time the school of engineering invites outsiders to come to have a speech.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or Fail. You have attend enough amount of seminars to get a pass. Attendance is taken through both student card and PRS clicker so don't bother to leave during the seminar.
reviews.comment_workload: Very low. You just need to use the PRS clicker to answer questions. It doesn't matter you answer it right or wrong. If you have forgotten to bring a PRS clicker, you can always ask them to give you a paper and answer the questions in essay format.

reviews.author: Andrew
reviews.title: 其實無乜可以comment
reviews.comment_content: 聽兩個talk，見Advisor一次，再玩吓PRS，算係輕鬆啦~ 最差係要take attandance啫...
reviews.comment_teaching: 呢啲無exam，無quiz，無assignment既course... 咁concern 個teaching嚟做乜啫~ （其實就教得麻麻，但0影響）
reviews.comment_grading: 得P，F同埋PP... 完全唔會爛grade（除非你連嗰兩個talk都唔出席啦）
reviews.comment_workload: 聽兩個talk既workload... 我就話唔係好多啫~

reviews.author: Yeung
reviews.comment_content: 聽幾個talks, 當中有2個係set好邊日要聽,其他只要選其中2個去聽就好
reviews.comment_teaching: 聽talk可以做自己野, 如果唔係太嘈都唔會俾prof話,見唔少人打機或瞓覺都無野
reviews.comment_grading: 只要聽幾個talks就pass,雖然有d talks 完左有份野要填,但唔覺錯得多會點,未見有人聽左talks而唔Pass
reviews.comment_workload: 0workload,除左聽talk外無野要做

reviews.author: tangcanyaotim
reviews.comment_content: 聽夠一定數目的課就可以pass啦，內容一般般大部分跟以後專業選擇有關，可以自行選擇要去聽哪節課咯。
reviews.comment_teaching: 大部分人過去只是take attendance 而已，有些課講的還是很不錯的
reviews.comment_grading: 聽夠一定數量的課就可以pass啦
reviews.comment_workload: 0 work load，唯一需要做的就是按時到場去聽課就行啦

reviews.author: mlkw314
reviews.comment_content: In addition to the compulsory lectures -- "University Education" and "Engineering Design Concept", you are also required to attend at least 2 professional development seminars in one semester, which include intros to different majors, and infos on exchange, internship, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Usually worth listening to what the lecturers have to say, as the information is important.
reviews.comment_grading: If you attend the compulsory lectures, the safety training modules, and at least two professional development seminar, then you get a pass. Otherwise, you fail.
reviews.comment_workload: All you have to do for this course is register for at least two seminars online, and attend those with your student ID card on time.

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.comment_content: A series of lectures related to the field of engineering. Interesting content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Usually really kind instructors. Was a bit late once but the lecturer took a picture of my student ID and told me that he would help me count my attendance.
reviews.comment_grading: You can't really fail unless you skip the compulsory lectures. It's probably the easiest course there is.
reviews.comment_workload: All you have to do is attend the compulsory lectures (the schedule and requirements will be given in the canvas.) Before going, you need to register using your student ID. During/after the lecture and do whatever prs/worksheets they tell you to do/fill out. It's almost impossible to fail it unless you somehow miss a lecture or two.

reviews.author: GK
reviews.title: Super good grade course
reviews.comment_content: You won't know the content of the course after studying the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: You won't know the teaching is good or bad because nobody would focus on the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: P or F. I got an P. I am both above and below mean. The grade is super good
reviews.comment_workload: You just have to attend the talk, doo the card, randomly press the PRS at the end of the lesson and everything is done. The workload is not big so it is the best course in HKUST other than HLTH1010

reviews.author: ustenginejai
reviews.comment_content:
聽talk
有1個compulsory talk,4個safety,同4個pds seminar,
safety係每個sem各2個，pds就成年加埋聽4個
safety無得揀，佢叫你去就去pds有十幾個，自己揀去4個，有d係關於揀major，可能去聽下
有d talk會用prs take attendance，有次試過有人入去時拍卡就走，點知個talk完要用返prs答問題
同埋要見advisor，fall一定要見一次，都係吹下水，問下你有無自殺傾向，spring就一係你好得閒主動搵佢，一係就你reg唔夠credits，或者gpa太低先要見佢
reviews.comment_teaching: 去到個個都係玩手機，勤力d咪做webwork...
reviews.comment_grading: not applicable,聽夠數就pass
reviews.comment_workload: 0credit course,無workload,聽talk，見advisor

reviews.author: McNuggets
reviews.title: Does seem to have some useful info
reviews.comment_content:
It is a two-semester compulsory course for all SENG students, which is automatically pre-enrolled for you before the formal course enrollment period.
Lectures/sessions/talks of ENGG1010 generally contain some introduction of different Engineering major, exchange and internship opportunities in SENG, extracurricular events and community, etc.
For me, it does help me get some useful information, yet very occasionally.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The first several introductory sessions are offered by Ben CHAN (CHAN, Yui Bun), who is kind of interesting.
Most of the following PDS talks are conducted by profs from different departments, but most of their talks are not so attractive, just focusing on PowerPoints. You can take some photos of the slides for future reference rather than listening to every word, which may be much more efficient.
reviews.comment_grading:
Just grading in Pass/Fail way.
A pass in it is a requirement for major selection at the ending of year 1, but it isn't a hard task at all.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very low. In total, it needs you no more than 5 hours.
Just don't forget the requirements:
1. Two compulsory lectures: one in Fall and one in Spring
2. Face-to-face chatting with Peer Mentor inside the clan, either individually or in group: once in Fall and once in Spring
3. Meeting with Faculty Advisor, either face-to-face or online: once compulsory in Fall, once voluntary in Spring
4. Attending approved Professional Development
Seminar/activity (PDS): 3 hours EACH semester.

reviews.author: Emperte
reviews.comment_content: chatbox is the spotlight
reviews.comment_teaching: ok la
reviews.comment_grading: p/f but i want a
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is heavy as f**k
You are required to find your peer mentor to talk about your future for at least 30 minutes.but the point is i dont wanna talk to him/her.why the f**k will i tell some random seniors about my plan and my dream.
Talking to a random will only make me more nervous.This doesnt help at all.
tl;dr not friendly to autistic students,like me and you

reviews.author: snowmaan
reviews.title: Self Explanitory
reviews.comment_content:
Fall Sem:
Compulsory lecture - 1
School Faculty Advisor Meeting - 1
Peer mentoring(Clan-wise) - 1
Compulsory Professional Development Seminar - 1
Safety Trainings - 2

Spring Sem:
Compulsory lecture - 1
Peer mentoring(Clan-wise) - 1
Compulsory Professional Development Seminar - 1
Safety Trainings - 2
reviews.comment_teaching: Lectures that talk about introduction to different majors and disciplines. Peer mentors are there to guide you throughout the lectures as well. Pretty simple.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or Fail. If you attend the required lectures that happen every now and then, you will pass without a problem and they will let you choose your major going into the second course.
reviews.comment_workload: Barely Any. Apart from the required lectures, there is nothing for you to do.

reviews.author: yaboi
reviews.title: Easy class, just study
reviews.comment_content: Not a lot of content, you've probably learned most of the stuff in high school physics. Just make sure that you're understanding of circuit is very solid, especially when it comes to calculating current through different components and what not.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Shen is very enthusiastic and is ready to answer any and all questions. His English is very good so there should be no problem when it comes to that. One gripe I have is that he is very, very boring and that might be partially due to the topic itself.
reviews.comment_grading: Make sure you attend all classes so you don't miss out on the surprise quizzes. The quizzes are pretty easy and open book but you only have 10 minutes. If you miss two quizzes then you get a 0 in the entire quiz portion. There are 3 total quizzes. Exams themselves are easy as long as you pay attention in class. Make sure you ace the lab sessions as well. It should be easy to get 100% in the labs.
reviews.comment_workload: The most intense work is building the robot itself. We didn't do that this time because of the protests but it was taking up the most time. Because of the protests, we ended up making robot design proposals which were easy. Took 3-4 hours total to make.

reviews.author: chingcching
reviews.title: no
reviews.comment_content:
this course is so boring and bad i have no absolute idea why i have to sit for like 10 hours per talk for like 6 times a year
why do they think people will listen to something they dont even care about in the first place
the talk is all about promotion of stupid activities and repeated talks about my career
reviews.comment_teaching: no teaching only listening
reviews.comment_grading: dear student dont give up if u want to give up think about ur parents
reviews.comment_workload: no workload only sitting and think about ur life

reviews.author: realSokki
reviews.comment_content: 聊天框是聚光燈，我已經被rickroll了很多次了，如果有機會，我必須把聊天框rickroll回去
reviews.comment_teaching: 好的啦
reviews.comment_grading:
過關或者失敗

如果你不能通過這門課程，你就不能在第 2 年選擇你的專業
reviews.comment_workload:
工作量十分大
你需要找你的同伴導師談論你的未來至少 30 分鐘。但重點是我不想和他/她說話

為什麼我會告訴一些隨機的前輩關於我的計劃和我的夢想

和一個隨機的人說話只會讓我更緊張，這根本沒有幫助
對像我和你這樣的自閉症學生不友好

reviews.author: DQK
reviews.title: good
reviews.comment_content: very inspiring. The instructor gave very useful information and taught us to be a good engineer. I think we should do our best and apply what we learned. I like it so much for it doesn't grade
reviews.comment_teaching: the instructor is so patient that he told many times. he is also very humorous, for he show some interesting vidoes
reviews.comment_grading:
the grade is very good because it doesn't count.
so my grade is good
reviews.comment_workload: we don't need to do anything after class for it doesn't grade.
